questions.question: Fluid A has a flow rate of 10.1 ml/sec. Fluid B has a flow rate of 11.3 ml/sec. Compared to fluid A, fluid B has.....

explanations.a: Not applicable here since viscosity can be inferred from flow rate.
explanations.b: Higher flow rate implies lower viscosity, not higher.
explanations.c: Correct. Faster flow indicates lower resistance to motion.
explanations.d: Flow rates differ, so viscosities are not equal.

questions.question: The unit of coefficient of viscosity in the CGS system is......

explanations.b: Correct. Poise is the CGS unit of dynamic viscosity.
explanations.c: This is the SI unit of viscosity.
explanations.d: dynes/cm is related to surface tension, not viscosity.

questions.question: In general, the viscosity of a liquid .......... with increase in temperature.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Liquids generally become less viscous at higher temperatures.
explanations.b: Correct. Increased temperature reduces cohesive forces.
explanations.d: Viscosity varies with temperature, not constant.
